p: There is very little information in the literature about C. montana and C. puberula. C. montana Small was reported in sandy woods and ravines, Appalachian plateau near Rugby, Tennessee while C. puberula Small was observed in pine-lands, northern Gulf coast region, Florida [ 26, 27]. Some taxonomic discrepancies surround C. montana and C. puberula since some experts treat both species as synonyms of C. verticillata and C. canescens, respectively.
